title: La NASA presenta sus nuevos directores de vuelo
summary: La NASA ha seleccionado a siete nuevos miembros para su cuadro de directores de vuelo, para supervisar las operaciones de las misiones de la Estación Espacial Internacional, de la tripulación comercial y del programa Artemis.

title: UK mulls Starlink expansion plan under new NGSO regulations
summary: The United Kingdom launched a public consultation June 21 under a recently strengthened licensing regime to consider Starlink’s expansion plans.

title: The final five: Ariane 5’s march to retirement begins with dual passenger launch
summary: Arianespace, ArianeGroup, and the European Space Agency (ESA) are gearing up for their second flight of the year and the first for the veteran Ariane 5 rocket, which begins its trek toward retirement with the first of its five final planned missions scheduled for lift-off from Kourou in French Guiana at 5:03 PM EDT (21:03 UTC) on June 22.

title: NASA's Curiosity Captures Stunning Views of a Changing Mars Landscape
summary: Striking rock formations documented by the rover provide evidence of a drying climate in the Red Planet’s ancient past.

title: For the first time, a small rocket will launch a private spacecraft to the Moon
summary: "It's really pushing the envelope as a commercially owned spacecraft operating at the Moon."

title: DoD Satcom: Big money for military satellites, slow shift to commercial services
summary: Big money for military satellites signals a slow shift to commercial services.

title: Viasat shareholders approve Inmarsat acquisition
summary: Viasat said June 21 that its shareholders voted to approve its $7.3 billion plan to acquire British satellite operator Inmarsat.

title: House bill trims NASA budget proposal
summary: A draft House spending bill would provide NASA with a smaller spending increase than requested for fiscal year 2023, with cuts spread among exploration, science and technology programs.

title: NASA encouraged by SLS countdown rehearsal
summary: NASA officials said they met most, but not all, of the objectives in a countdown rehearsal of the Space Launch System, and were still determining if they were ready to move ahead with the vehicle’s first launch.

title: Kuaizhou-1A returns to flight with test satellite launch
summary: A Chinese Kuaizhou-1A rocket sent the Tianxing-1 satellite into orbit late Tuesday, marking a return to flight six months after the solid light-light launcher suffered failure.
